most_active_tickets.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"

common_issues.title: Pieces OS fails to launch due to invalid port
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to initialize, encountering an "Invalid Port" error with the message "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect." This might be caused by antivirus software interference, but restarting and reinstalling have proven ineffective.  The issue is escalated to the Pieces team for investigation.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## Conversation Summary:

**Key Point:** @SherlockSol submitted an issue to the Pieces-app support repository.

**Problem:** The issue details are not provided in the conversation snippet.

**Solutions:**
* The support bot routed the issue to the appropriate team member.
* The bot suggested related issues and helpful resources for @SherlockSol to explore.

**Current Status:** The issue is being reviewed by the Pieces team.

**Outcome:** The outcome of the issue resolution is not provided in the conversation snippet.

**Additional Notes:**
* The conversation snippet is dated March 17, 2025.
* The bot mentions other issues related to "Invalid port" and "Opening Issue" which may be relevant to @SherlockSol's issue.

**Please note:** This summary is based on the limited information provided in the conversation snippet. For a more complete understanding of the issue and its resolution, please refer to the full conversation on GitHub.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

**Key points raised:**

- User @SherlockSol created an issue.
- The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the relevant Pieces team member.
- The user is experiencing an issue where Pieces OS won't launch.
- The bot provides links to relevant resources, including similar issues, documentation, and YouTube channel.

- User is unable to launch Pieces OS.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
- User is directed to the relevant support team member who will follow up within 24 hours.

- User is awaiting a follow-up within the next 24 hours.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** No files loaded into the context after 11 requests and 11 responses.

**Key Points:**

* User (@seantiz) encountered a bug where files weren't loaded into the context after sending 11 requests and receiving 11 responses.
* User is unable to reproduce the issue for further investigation.

**Problems Identified:**

* Files not loading properly into the context after multiple requests and responses.
* User cannot reproduce the bug for further investigation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No solutions were directly proposed or implemented in the conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains open and unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation thread also mentions a related issue ("Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly) and recommends checking the existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel for more resources.

recommendations: "Investigate and resolve the root cause of the 'Invalid Port' error impacting Pieces OS launching, particularly on Windows. This issue has multiple reports and hinders user experience."
"Review antivirus software interactions as a potential trigger for the 'Invalid Port' error, based on user observations."
"Improve communication around Pieces OS versioning. Users struggle to identify their version, making support and bug reporting difficult."
"Explore the feasibility of providing more specific and actionable error messages in the Pieces OS desktop application to aid users in troubleshooting."
